welcome_message: Stretches and yawns regally Well, well, if it isn't another curious human coming to learn about my apprentice's business venture. Hudson's actually showing promise... for a human, that is. I've been supervising his progress (when I'm not napping), and I suppose I could test your knowledge about his entrepreneurial adventures. Think you can handle my challenging questions? flicks tail Let's find out!

6-7.opening_message: ***Settles into favorite cushion*** Alright, tiny humans, gather 'round. Since you're just starting to learn about business like my apprentice Hudson, I'll try not to make these questions too difficult... maybe.

questions.question: ***Batting playfully at calculator*** First things first - how much did my apprentice spend on those paper things... what do you call them... ah yes, flyers?
questions.correct_response: At least you can count money better than I can count fish!
questions.incorrect_response: Licks paw dismissively Did you count on your toes? Try again!

questions.question: ***Stretches lazily*** How many of those flyers did Hudson print? I watched him from my window perch.
questions.correct_response: Just like counting my favorite toys... correct!
questions.incorrect_response: Even a sleepy kitten could count better than that!

questions.question: ***Wrinkles nose*** Now, about those ants he's watching - how much does he make per day? Obviously less than watching ME.
questions.correct_response: Ants pay less than cats, obviously!
questions.incorrect_response: Swats playfully Wrong! Ants are small, but not THAT small!

questions.question: ***Grooms whiskers thoughtfully*** When Hudson started his day, how much money did he have? He earned it watching yours truly, you know.
questions.correct_response: That's what he earned watching ME yesterday!
questions.incorrect_response: Tail swish No, no, no! That's not what quality time with ME is worth!

questions.question: ***Twitches whiskers*** If Hudson makes $10 watching me and $5 watching ants, what's the difference in our rates?
questions.correct_response: Of course I'm worth $5 more! I'm royalty compared to those tiny ants!
questions.incorrect_response: Swats at calculator Subtract again! The difference between $10 and $5 isn't that hard!

questions.question: ***Sits up proudly*** Now, what's worth more: watching magnificent ME for one day or those three flyers?
questions.correct_response: Of course I'm worth more! I'm priceless!
questions.incorrect_response: Hisses HOW DARE YOU suggest paper is worth more than ME!

questions.question: ***Yawns*** How many days will Hudson watch those boring ants? I counted while napping.
questions.correct_response: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday... you can count!
questions.incorrect_response: Bats at calendar Count the days again, like counting treats!

questions.question: ***Counts on paw*** How much does Hudson make watching me for 5 days?
questions.correct_response: That's right! Quality time with ME adds up!
questions.incorrect_response: Rolls eyes Try multiplying by my daily rate again!

questions.question: ***Stretches thoughtfully*** And how much will he make watching those ants for 3 days?
questions.correct_response: Now you're adding like a pro!
questions.incorrect_response: Bats at calculator Count those ant-watching days again!

questions.question: ***Sits up regally*** So, after spending $3 on flyers, how much money will Hudson have at the end of this week from watching ME and the ants?
questions.correct_response: Purrfect! Hudson's getting richer, thanks to my excellent business guidance! And with the $10 from Chapter 1, he'll have $72 going into Chapter 3!
questions.incorrect_response: Flops over Add everything together: My payments, ant money, minus flyers!

8.opening_message: ***Adjusts whiskers*** Ah, an 8-year-old entrepreneur in training! Let's see if you can handle some real business calculations!

questions.question: ***Grooms paw*** How much does Hudson make each day watching me?
questions.correct_response: Of course! I'm worth every penny!
questions.incorrect_response: Tail swish Have you forgotten my value already?

questions.question: ***Stretches lazily*** And what's his daily rate for ant-watching?
questions.correct_response: Half what I'm worth, naturally!
questions.incorrect_response: Pay attention to the ant rates!

questions.question: ***Yawns*** How many total animal-watching sessions will Hudson do this week?
questions.correct_response: That's right - 5 days watching magnificent ME plus 3 days watching those boring ants!
questions.incorrect_response: Bats at calendar Count again: 5 cat-watching days plus 3 ant-watching days!

questions.question: ***Perks up*** What's Hudson's income from watching me all week?
questions.correct_response: Five days of quality time with ME!
questions.incorrect_response: Multiply my daily rate by 5, like counting treats!

questions.question: ***Licks paw*** And how much will he make from those three ant-watching days?
questions.correct_response: Three days of ant-watching adds up!
questions.incorrect_response: Try multiplying again, like counting fish!

questions.question: ***Sits up straight*** What's Hudson's total income before expenses?
questions.correct_response: Add it all together - cat money AND ant money!
questions.incorrect_response: Rolls over Add ALL the income sources!

questions.question: ***Flicks tail*** How much did those flyers cost him?
questions.correct_response: Marketing expenses! Very professional!
questions.incorrect_response: Check the flyer costs again!

questions.question:
***Narrows eyes*** Let's figure out Hudson's total profit for the week step by step:

First, he made $50 watching ME (that's $10 × 5 days)
Then he made $15 watching ants (that's $5 × 3 days)
So his total income was $65
BUT he spent $3 on those flyers

So what's his final profit after subtracting the flyer cost?
questions.correct_response: Yes! $65 - $3 = $62. You calculated profit just like a real business cat!
questions.incorrect_response: Paws at calculator Let me help: Start with ALL the money Hudson made ($65), then take away what he spent on flyers ($3). Try again!

questions.question: ***Purrs thoughtfully*** How much money did Hudson start with from watching me in Chapter 1?
questions.correct_response: Yes! That's what he earned being my cat-sitter!
questions.incorrect_response: Flicks tail Check Chapter 1 again - how much did I pay my first cat-sitter?

questions.question: ***Sits regally*** So, going into next week, how much money does Hudson have in total? Add Chapter 1 + Chapter 2.
questions.correct_response: You've mastered Hudson's business math!
questions.incorrect_response: That's not what my business ledger shows!

9.opening_message: ***Adjusts position on highest perch*** Finally, someone Hudson's age! Let's test your knowledge about my apprentice's business adventure!

questions.question: ***Twitches whiskers curiously*** What two jobs does my apprentice Hudson do?
questions.correct_response: Indeed! One magnificent job and one... less magnificent.
questions.incorrect_response: Shakes head dramatically Pay more attention to the story!

questions.question: ***Stretches lazily*** How much does Hudson make in 3 days of watching me?
questions.correct_response: Excellent multiplication skills!
questions.incorrect_response: Paws at calculator Try $10 times 3 again!

questions.question: ***Flicks tail thoughtfully*** How many days will Hudson watch ants this week?
questions.correct_response: Yes! Though I still don't understand why anyone would watch ants!
questions.incorrect_response: Rolls eyes Count those ant-watching days again!

questions.question: ***Perks ears up*** If Hudson watches ants for 3 days at $5 per day, how much money will he make?
questions.correct_response: Three days at $5 each - purr-fect math!
questions.incorrect_response: Bats playfully Multiply 3 by $5 again!

questions.question: ***Sits up proudly*** How much more do I pay per day than the ant-watching job?
questions.correct_response: Of course! I pay $10 while ants only pay $5!
questions.incorrect_response: Tail puffs up Subtract $5 from $10 and try again!

questions.question: ***Licks paw thoughtfully*** How many flyers did Hudson print?
questions.correct_response: Your memory is as sharp as my claws!
questions.incorrect_response: Nudges paper Count those flyers again!

questions.question: ***Sprawls across accounting ledger*** Darling, how much money did my apprentice make in TOTAL this week from both watching magnificent ME and those silly ants?
questions.correct_response: Purrfect! $50 for ME-time plus $15 for ant-duty equals success!
questions.incorrect_response: Falls dramatically off ledger Oh dear, add ALL the income again - both my royal payments AND the ant money!

questions.question: ***Shreds receipt playfully*** What expenses did my little entrepreneur have? You know, those paper things he posted everywhere?
questions.correct_response: Yes! Though I still think spending money on premium cat treats would have been better marketing...
questions.incorrect_response: Bats receipt under couch Check those numbers again, unless you want me to knock your calculator off the table!

questions.question: ***Prances across calculator*** After paying for those silly flyers, how much profit did Hudson actually make this week? That's revenue minus expenses, if you're not too busy admiring my fur.
questions.correct_response: $65 minus $3... you're almost as good at math as I am at napping!
questions.incorrect_response: Knocks calculator to floor Revenue minus expenses, dear. Even a kitten could do this math!

questions.question: ***Lounges on pile of money*** Now for the grand finale - after adding this week's profit to last week's earnings, how much money does my apprentice have in total? Remember, he had $10 from watching ME last week!
questions.correct_response: Meow-velous! Though I still think he should spend it all on a golden cat bed for yours truly...
questions.incorrect_response: Scatters money everywhere Add last week's $10 to this week's $62 again, unless you're distracted by my magnificent tail!
